fields.description: Now Stories can be created under epics and only subtasks can be created under stories. Issue is subtasks cannot be in different projects. Give us a new hierarchy level where I can create a new Standard Issue type under story.
fields.summary: Need a hierarchy level after Story.

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour
Calculation of sprint per day is done in 24 hours segments.
E.g. Sprint starts on Monday at 9 am and ends on Tuesday at 5 pm, the number of days calculated as 1, as the 2nd day ends on Wednesday at 9 am.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Customer would like his work hours to be honoured, which means in the above example, with his workday set to 9 am through 5 pm, the number of days should be calculated as 2 .
fields.summary: Calculation of Sprint days

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Just like how there's a comment history on Issues for several users to discuss the ticket, such a feature is needed on a Project level so that users can comment on Projects where a history is kept to be viewed and commented on by other users.
\\
\\
||Original request||
|Is there a place or option to have a discussion with other people in the project? Comments in Issue is used to discuss stuffs related to that particular issue. So my query is if we need to discuss with things commonly related to a project do we have option like Project forum or chats within project or product.|
fields.summary: Project discussions

fields.description:
Looks like this has been requested before in JRASERVER-63353, but closed due to "limited demand" - so I want to show that there is demand for this very simple change.

Every time I add a hyperlink for a preselected text, it selects the text, not the example URL. That way I have to select the example URL manually to replace it with the correct URL. Please automatically select the URL instead, since it is the most likely to get edited in this use case.
fields.summary: Preselect example URL, not text, when adding external link

fields.description:

When a Jira instance has multiple add-ons, loading an issue will load all the add-ons, causing slowness in loading.

Code block should highlight SQL sintax

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you click to delete a Screen Scheme but you associate it with an Issue Type Screen Scheme before it is deleted, Jira will let you delete the Screen Scheme.

If the Issue Type Screen Scheme is being used by any project, *all* "Screens" page of project settings will be blank.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click to Delete a Screen Scheme. You'll be taken to this page:
  !Delete_Screen_Scheme_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
 # On another tab, associate this Screen Scheme to an Issue Type Screen Scheme, as shown in the screenshot below:
  !Configure_Issue_Type_Screen_Scheme__Testing_bug_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
 # Go back to the other tab and complete the deletion of the Screen Scheme.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should not let you delete the Screen Scheme since it's associated with an Issue Type Screen Scheme.
h3. Actual Results

The Screen Scheme will be deleted and the Issue Type Screen Scheme will be shown as a blank:
  !Configure_Issue_Type_Screen_Scheme__Testing_bug_-_Jira-2.png|thumbnail! 

If the Issue Type Screen Scheme is associated with any project, the "Screen" tab of *every* project settings will be blank:

 !Blank Screen Page.png|thumbnail! 

It will also not be possible to *create an issue* of that issue type in the projects associated with the Issue Type Screen Scheme.

Whenever you try to create an issue, the following error will be thrown:
{code:java}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: eq(null) is not allowed. Use isNull() instead
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: eq(null) is not allowed. Use isNull() instead
    at com.querydsl.core.types.dsl.SimpleExpression.eq(SimpleExpression.java:127)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.QueryDslFieldScreenSchemeManager.lambda$getFieldScreenScheme$2(QueryDslFieldScreenSchemeManager.java:74)
    at com.atlassian.jira.database.DefaultQueryDslAccessor.lambda$executeQuery$0(DefaultQueryDslAccessor.java:55)
    at com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseAccessorImpl.lambda$runInTransaction$0(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:71)
    at com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseAccessorImpl.executeQuery(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:40)
    at com.atlassian.jira.database.DatabaseAccessorImpl.runInTransaction(DatabaseAccessorImpl.java:66)
    at com.atlassian.jira.database.DefaultQueryDslAccessor.executeQuery(DefaultQueryDslAccessor.java:54)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.QueryDslFieldScreenSchemeManager.getFieldScreenScheme(QueryDslFieldScreenSchemeManager.java:72)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.CachingFieldScreenSchemeManager.lambda$getFieldScreenScheme$2(CachingFieldScreenSchemeManager.java:44)
    at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.metrics.TimedSupplier.get(TimedSupplier.java:32)
    at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.DefaultRequestCache.lambda$get$2(DefaultRequestCache.java:52)
    at java.util.Optional.orElseGet(Optional.java:267)
    at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.DefaultRequestCache.get(DefaultRequestCache.java:50)
    at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.metrics.TimedLocalCacheOperations.get(TimedLocalCacheOperations.java:64)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.CachingFieldScreenSchemeManager.getFieldScreenScheme(CachingFieldScreenSchemeManager.java:44)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.issuetype.IssueTypeScreenSchemeEntityImpl.getFieldScreenScheme(IssueTypeScreenSchemeEntityImpl.java:81)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.issuetype.DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager.getFieldScreenSch{code}
 !Create_issue_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

It's not possible to fix this through the UI as if you try to change the Screen Scheme it'll take you to a 500 error page.

Contact our support so we can apply the workaround in your instance since it requires an update on the database to fix the Issue Type Screen Scheme.
fields.summary: Deleting a Screen Scheme associated with an Issue Type Screen Scheme will make all "Screens" pages to go blank

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you try to edit the name of the first transition in a workflow, it will throw an error "The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From Jira Dashboard type gg and enter "Workflows"
 # Choose "Edit" on any workflow
 # Check box to "Show transitions"
 # Select FIRST transition on workflow and choose "Edit"
 # Change name and click "save"

h3. Expected Results

Workflow transition name should be updated to the workflow
h3. Actual Results

Error - "The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
{code:java}
java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.workflow.Workflow.isDuplicateStepTransitionName(Workflow.java:775) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.workflow.Workflow.isDuplicateTransitionName(Workflow.java:725) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.workflow.Workflow.isDuplicateTransitionName(Workflow.java:482) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.workflow.WorkflowTransitions.verifyTransitionCanBeUpdated(WorkflowTransitions.java:293) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.workflow.WorkflowTransitions.updateTransition(WorkflowTransitions.java:77) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.rest.WorkflowTransitionsResource.updateTransition(WorkflowTransitionsResource.java:99) at 
{code}
h3. Notes

Have been able to replicate
h3. Workaround

# Choose *Edit* on the workflow
# Choose *Text* button on top of screen
# Select FIRST *Step name (id)* that is part of your workflow - Note, this may not be on the top of the list, find it by name
# Select the transistion name in question on next screen choose *Edit* option
# Change transition name and click *Update*
fields.summary: Unable to edit first transition name in workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *Atlassian Update, April 12th, 2019:*
* Ability to modify 'atlassian-addons-project-access' project role was removed - from Jira UI and API
* It's now a read-only role that is automatically updated by Jira when app is installed or un-installed
* Misconfigured 'atlassian-addons-project-access' roles were cleaned up:
** Non app users were removed from the role
** Missing app users were re-added to the role
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
After the changes on project roles for Atlassian add-ons (e.g atlassian-addons-project-access), there are some users/groups who are still members of this project role. The users in *atlassian-addons-project-access* will be granted permissions based on the add-on project role.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Unable to reproduce this via the UI as the ability to add users and groups to the Project Role *atlassian-addons-project-access* has been removed

h3. Expected Results
* User and Group should not be included in this project role, only Atlassian Apps (add-on)

h3. Actual Results
* Admin's permission helper in issue shows that the user is members of 'atlassian-addons-project-access', and is granted with the permission
* Project role atlassian-addons-project-access grants access to all Issue Security Levels in a Scheme. This may cause users/group in that Security scheme to see Jira issues incorrectly, despite having the correct configuration on the instance
* Project role for atlassian-addons-project-access is not listed in Project *People* page. Admins cannot change this via the UI, an update will need to be done via the database by Atlassian Support to remove this Project Role not giving to apps

h3. Workaround
* That was an interim issue and to fix that please [*contact support*|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: User/Group is member of 'atlassian-addons-project-access' project role but is not listed in default members

fields.description:
While on a kanban board, I click the '+' to create an issue and after saving, a message pops up 'Your issue xxxx has been created but is not currently visible'. It seems I have to:
1) select backlog
2) search for the new issue
3) drag into 'selected for development'
4) switch back to the kanban board
5) now I can move the issue to where it belongs on the kanban board.

This is slow and frustrating every time I'm on the kanban and need to quickly create an issue.
If I'm on the kanban and create an issue, couldn't it be added to the kanban by default?
fields.summary: Simplify workflow on kanban when adding new issue

fields.description:
{panel:title=Product Update - Feb 13th, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, thank you for your patience on this issue, we have finally shipped the capability to add and remove watchers from the Watchers dropdown in the new issue view. Just look for the little eye icon in the top right of the new issue detail view. 

Once you select that you will see a dropdown showing the list of people watching, as well as the ability to add or remove others. You must have permissions to do this action, otherwise, it will not be visible and you can only watch/unwatch the issue yourself.

Thanks for your patience and if you have any other questions specific to this feature, please ask here.

Taylor Pechacek, Jira Cloud PM

 
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in the Jira New Issue View, you're only allowed to add yourself as a watcher. It isn't possible to add other users as watchers and see the watcher list.

!Screen Shot 2018-07-02 at 18.31.28.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to add other users as watchers see the Watcher list, as it's possible in the Old Issue View.

!Screen Shot 2018-07-02 at 18.31.10.png|thumbnail!
h3. Why this is important

It's an existing feature that is used by many customers so it's important to still allow this functionality.
h3. Workaround

(Optional)
 Switch back to The Old issue view on the profile settings' Lab section.
fields.summary: Allow to add other users as Watchers and see the Watcher List in the New Issue View

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to include the ability to measure usage statistics for each individual add-on within a Cloud instance. 

That would allow administrators to determine which add-ons are providing their organization with the most value, and can be great for billing and technical reporting.

fields.description:
Through the UI, you are capable of granting a user the Administer Projects project permission but also denying them the Browse Projects project permission. As a result, this user can get to the admin console if they know the URL or also send admin requests via the REST API, but that user cannot see the project in the list of projects or view tickets, etc.

I'm guessing this is not an intentional state to allow users to get themselves into this situation.

Here's how I did this:
 # Define a custom project role with no default actors (i.e., default members), _my-custom-project-role_.
 # Define a custom permission scheme (i.e., not the default scheme) that uses custom groups. The scheme restricts access based on custom groups like _company-name-developers_, _company-name-admins_, etc., and does not use default groups to grant permissions.
 # Have a user, _Leo_, that is not a member of any of the custom groups but who belongs to all default Jira groups and has application access to Jira.
 # Grant _Leo_ admin permissions (Administer Project project permission) for the project via _my-custom-project role_ (depends upon this role being granted admin permission in the permission scheme).
 # Use the Permission helper to confirm that Leo cannot Browse Projects for the project but does have Administer Project.
 # Observe that _Leo_ can send admin requests to below and get successful responses (works for other methods):
{code:java}
PUT /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}{code}

 # Observe that _Leo_ can access the admin console for the project and make changes to the project but cannot view tickets.

*Expectation*

It seems inconsistent that you'd be able to admin a project for which you cannot view issues or browse to the admin console. It should be either not possible to put the user in that state, or the consequences of such permissions set-up should be more clear when setting them.
fields.summary: Improve UX for users with Administer Project but without Browse Project permission

h3. Actual Results

h3.Workaround

h3. Summary
When an app opens a new dialog box from the New Issue view (this is a dialog opened when an issue is clicked), and the user submits it, an error is thrown:

{code}
Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded.
    at Object.trigger (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:118)
    at HTMLButtonElement.<anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:133)
    at Function.each (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:70)
    at init.each (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:63)
    at init.trigger (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:133)
    at init.c.fn.(/secure/anonymous function) [as _focus] (https://d265epinkb1tkr.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-us-2--3--jres.atlassian.net/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-2zeky4/b/6/24b45da91169b35b1ed0c356f0e89083/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:134:421)
    at init.focus (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:861)
    at HTMLDocument.j (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:667)
    at HTMLDocument.dispatch (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:120)
    at HTMLDocument.h (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:112)
{code}

is returned and the form not submitted.

*Steps to replicate*
# Install "Issue Templates" app
# Go to a software project which has a board
# Go to an active board and select an issue. Make sure that the "Open issues in a dialog" is enabled
# Click on an issue, which will result in a new dialog showing details of the issue
# Click on More or (...) icon to display more options
# Click on "Apply template" (from Issue Templates), which will open a new dialog for the user to submit
# Select any template and submit and error is thrown.

h3. Investigation
Replicated on cloud instance. I think this is because you have to many dialogs opened. When you try to submit a form using the "Open issues in sidebar" option, the app's form from the dialog is successfully submitted

More details in the supporting ticket

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While linking issues in Jira and a search is run for Confluence pages, sometimes the output contains more results then the length of the modal window. In this case, the results are not shown completely and last result line is shown cut off.  A scroll-bar is required to display the complete results.

!Screen Shot 2018-06-27 at 9.58.56 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 Inspecting the page shows that further results are available but not showing on the search result modal window.
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-27 at 9.59.00 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Open an issue in Jira cloud
 # Click on *...* on top-left and select *Link* option
 # Click on *Confluence pages* in the left panel
 # Click on *Search for pages* link
 # Type a title of the page. Make sure there are enough pages with that title to fill up the modal window. Possibly more than 10

h3. Expected Results

Search results show correctly formatted with a scrollbar to scroll down to see all results.
h3. Actual Results

Search will be showing incomplete results and no scrollbar is showing.
h3. Notes

Likely to be a UI issue. Maybe the result set is limited to show a certain number of rows. But possibly a scrollbar can fix the issue. Tested in Chrome (latest) and Safari (latest).
h3. Workaround

No current workaround.
fields.summary: Confluence page search not showing all results while linking an issue

fields.description:
{panel:title=Product Update - Dec 20th, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#add8e6|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, I am happy to share with you that we have rolled out the ability to configure the field layout on the new issue view! This is available to all customers who have the new issue view enabled. You can find more information here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configure-field-layout-in-the-issue-view-961798059.html] 

Here are a couple of key points about this you should know. More detailed info is in the docs link above.
 * This only applies to classic projects that are using the new issue view. Next-gen project types already have the ability to add/remove/edit the field ordering of the issue view. See [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-next-gen-software-projects-945104895.html] 
 * The new Issue Layout option in your project settings is what allows you to order your fields. It still gets the list of available fields from your global screen config that is being applied to the specific issue type you are editing within that project. If you change the ordering this will *only* affect the field layout for those issue types within that specific project. The new Issue Layout option is *not* a global setting. It is a per project setting.
 * Only project admins and site admins have access to this Issue Layout option. It can be accessed by clicking on the ... within any issue detail view. Or go to your project settings.

If you have any questions, or would like to see some improvements, there is a feedback collector on the Issue Layout edit page. So give us your feedback, we are looking to iterate and improve this moving forward but we are excited about this change. We hope it makes using the new issue view much more enjoyable!

Taylor Pechacek, Jira Cloud - Sr. PM

 
{panel}

h3. Summary
Order of fields is not respected in the new issue view 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the view issue screen by setting fields to respect a certain order. 
# When you access directly the issue you can see that the order is respected on the view screen.
# When you view the issue through the new issue view you will notice that the order is not respected. 

h3. Expected Results
* Fields order respected as per the screen configuration. 

h3. Actual Results
* On the old issue view the order is respected. 
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* On the new issue view the order is not respected. 
**   !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* Please check the linked feature request also on the same context: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68967

h3.Workaround
* Currently, the only workaround is to access the issue link to get the old issue view.
fields.summary: Order of fields is not respected in the new issue view

*Story*

When creating external links from comments in Jira/Service Desk, I need the URL portion of the added syntax to automatically highlight, so that I can immediately type the URL I want without clicking and dragging to select sample URL first.

When creating external links from a comment, I have to select the text I want to be the link, choose to make an external link (which adds the syntax for me) and then I have to click and drag to select the URL section of the syntax so that I can type in what I actually want.  If it would automatically highlight that for me it would be a MUCH better experience.

Video demo:  [http://fiber.angelleye.com/video/jira-external-links-from-comments.mp4]

Maybe there's some other way I should go about this to make it better..??  Any feedback would be greatly appreciated.  Thanks!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating a new application link for a generic application primarily with incoming links, then creating an Oauth token for the application to use will cause the page at https://INSTANCENAME.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens
to give a 500 error.
=== 500 Error ===
 !500 error.png|thumbnail! 
===

h3. Environment
Cloud instance. Seems to impact Jira side of things.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Simply create a simple Oauth script to test incoming Oauth connection to Jira.
- Set up a Application link connection for the script using some dummy information in the outgoing Oauth Connection. And put in the proper information for the Incoming.
- Run the script at least up to the point where you get the URL to allow the Application access to the instance.
- Authorize the access.
- Browse to the Oauth token management page (https://INSTANCENAME.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens) to manage the token.

h3. Expected Results
The page loads and you are able to manage the Oauth Tokens

h3. Actual Results
You get the 500 error.
Errors are like this one.
=== Complete Error ===
 [^complete-error.txt] 
===
 
h3. Notes
None.

h3.Workaround
Deleting the Application link allows the page to load again, however, I did not test exhaustively, so I am not certain that the issue will not present itself later.
fields.summary: Visiting /plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens returns 500 error when Generic App Access Token exists

fields.description:
Currently when you upload a backup file to restore to a cloud instance, it will go through the phase *uploading* -> *processing* before forwarding to a page where you can choose to enable disable outgoing mail and update url.

When the file is being processed, a refresh of the page will cause the progress no longer to be seen although it is still running at the background. 

To replicate this behavior, just do the following:
# Upload a file (relatively big in size, around 100MB) for import
# When it is processing like the screenshot below, just refresh the page:
!image-2018-06-25-19-49-40-156.png|thumbnail! 
# Notice that it is left with only *Begin Import* and *Import Attachment* upon page load, progress bar no longer anywhere to be found
 !image-2018-06-25-19-50-36-115.png|thumbnail! 

This is causing the import for bigger customers harder than it already is. The processing might take up to 2 hours in some case and during this phase, if there is network changes, the page will reload by itself causing all progress to be starting from scratch again.

It would be great if we can resume the progress after a reload, that would save a lot of time and does not waste multiple resources to run the processing of the file.
fields.summary: Ability to Resume Progress During the Processing Phase of Import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In some of the documentations, the instructions to add new users, are not updated and provide misleading information. For example, in the following KB step 3 is referring to the button *Create users*, which no longer exist in JIRA Cloud user management:
- [Add new users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-core/add-new-users-917965387.html]

The button to add new users in JIRA Cloud is *Invite user* / *Invite users* currently.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Please update the documentations about user management (creating users) and update the instructions.
# It would be also helpful to include further clarification about the feature *Invite new users* (see screenshot below) in the user management KBs. This feature appears only when there are less than 6 _active_ users in user management, and it will be hidden if there are more:
 !User Management 2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Update documentation "Add new users"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a site indexing language is configured for Chinese/Japanese/Korea, the quick search result are inaccurate for searches up to 3 or 4 characters in length. Other characters of other length return the correct result.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Under General configurations make sure the indexing language is set to Chinese/Japanese/Korea
# Create an issue with the text "액티비티"
# Click the quick search on the left bar.
# Search for "액티비티" (No result)
# Search for "액티비" (No result)
# Search for "액티" (returns result)
# Search for "액" (returns result)

h3. Expected Results
All search in the test above should have returned a result. The issue or associated results are returned

h3. Actual Results
No results found is what is returned even though results exist for step for and 5 above. It's also searchable for the reporter and assignee.

h3. Workaround
Use the issue navigator to search -  https://<instance>.atlassian.net/issues
fields.summary: Chinese/Japanese/Korea indexing language search result wrong

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers have noticed that in their Jira Issue Activity, the New Value for some fields are appearing as the Raw String rather than being interpreted 

This was first noticed in the Description field where line breaks are showing up as {{\r\n}}

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Issue
# Update the Description Field

h3. Expected Results
All and History Activity shows line breaks 

h3. Actual Results
!Description1.png|thumbnail!  
!Description2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The Original Value correctly shows the line breaks however the New Value does not interpret the line breaks as such

h3.Workaround
None, appears to be a visual issue in the Activity of the Issue, viewed Description appears correctly
fields.summary: Issue Activity Shows Raw Line Break for New Value

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking to "Set up wallboard slideshow", it displays the below error.
 !Communication Breakdown.png|thumbnail! 

This below error are on the browser console.
{code}Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 () - https://<instance>.atlassian.net/ConfigureWallboard!default.jspa?inline=true&decorator=dialog&_=1529687690547{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an dashboard
# Click in the "..." and choose to "Set up wallboard slideshow"


h3. Expected Results
Set up the dashboard as wallboard slideshow.


h3. Actual Results
Displays the error mentioned.

 
h3.Workaround
Set the configuration directly in the URL.
E.g:
plugins/servlet/Wallboard/?dashboardId=10102&dashboardId=10100&cyclePeriod=4000&transitionFx=none&random=false

Or extensions for Google Chrome, for example.
https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/revolver-tabs/dlknooajieciikpedpldejhhijacnbda?hl=en
fields.summary: Communication Breakdown When Setting Up Wallboard Slideshow

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When an attachment's upload fails, Jira throws an error message.

It seems like Jira is trying to call some attributes in order to build the message, but it is failing:
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-22 at 11.08.13.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-21 at 10.59.54 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to upload an attachment to an issue;
 # Interrupt it's upload progress.


h3. Expected Results

The message should be user friendly, probably something like: *"attachment's name" upload failed*.

h3. Actual Results

The message is not correctly built.

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Error message format when attachments are not uploaded

fields.description:

The gadgets showing data from a self-hosted Bamboo site are no longer supported in Jira Cloud as of July 2017. This affects only the gadgets; the application link (the connection) between the Jira Cloud site and the self-hosted Bamboo site is supported and should work normally 

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Re-introduce this feature

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Re-introduce gadgets showing data from a self-hosted Bamboo

fields.description:
noticed that the line formatting is present inside the notification's email for the Description field's change.
  !Screen Shot 2018-06-21 at 13.56.11.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-06-22 at 10.19.04.png|thumbnail! 

We can see \r\n at the start of each lines and depending of the text within this field, other line formatting characters like "/s" or "/t" can also appear within the text. Either HTML or Text formatting is selected for the outgoing email format.

Regarding the wiki markup a feature request is already raised https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31199


*Update on 28/06/2018*: 
This new bug is affecting the description field's values also within the Issue Details View's Activity Tabs, History and within the Webhooks too.
Another thing is *the new values are now within quotes* (see Activity Tab, History Tab and Webhook Screenshot below).

Activity Tab:

 !Screen Shot 2018-06-28 at 13.56.46.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-06-28 at 14.24.01.png|thumbnail! 

History:
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-28 at 14.23.34.png|thumbnail! 

Webhook:
 !jira-markup-issue-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The line formatting characters (e.g \t\n\s) are shown for the description's text within the notification emails. Update on 28/06/2018: Values are now within quotes ("...") and it affects the Issue Details View's Tabs and the Webhooks too

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users cannot turn off autowatch. When accessing a user profile and change the value “*Inherit from global settings” to “Disable” then click on “Save changes”, the following error is displayed:
{quote}! Couldn’t´t save your preferences
 Something went wrong. Try again
 Reload the page
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

The Autowatch feature should be configurable per user.
h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to disable the autowatch preferences.
h3. Notes

To access the User default page:
{noformat}
https://{instancename}.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
{noformat}
Documentation for this page:
 * [Configuring the user default settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-the-user-default-settings-800708207.html]

h3. Workaround

Update your language in the Personal Settings and then change the auto watch settings.
fields.summary: Users cannot turn off autowatch

fields.description:
h3. Summary
You cannot add a group to any project role if there is a whitespace at the end of the group name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group with a space at the end (eg:GROUPNAME<space>.)
# Add the group as a default group in a project role

 !Administration.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Group added to the project role.

h3. Actual Results
You are unable to add the group the role, you instead get an error message *We can't find 'GROUPNAME' in any accessible user directory. Check they're still active and available, and try again.*

 !Assign_Default_Groups_to_Project_Role__Developers_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Delete the group and recreate it in the *User management* without any spaces.
fields.summary: Unable to add group to a project role if there is a whitespace in the group name

fields.description:

# Use OAuth

Successfully download a file

h3. Actual Results
Status 500

Request with Basic authorization is successful. It's reproduced by many clients (Java, .Net).

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running an import/restore - Jira accounts that have been deleted are re-created during the import/restore process.  Example of a deleted account as it would appear in the Jira database or the entities.xml file(found in the backup.zip).
 || id || user_name || active || display_name || email_address || deleted_externally | 
 | 12345 | example.user | 0 | Example User [X] | example_user@exampledomain.eu | 1 | 

This can be a problem as the re-creation of the deleted accounts can cause confusion for Jira admins.  When coupled with [JRACLOUD-65068|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65068], filter subscription emails can be sent to users who have been deleted from an instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a full backup of a Jira Cloud instance
# Restore the backup to a Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results
* Users that are marked as "deleted_externally" should remain in the dame state

h3. Actual Results
* Jira accounts are re-created and are marked as "inactive"

h3.Workaround
* Manually delete the users after the import has completed
fields.summary: Deleted users are re-created as "inactive" users during restore/import process

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to use the option  *Export this filter in another format* > 'Export Excel CSV (All fields)' with issues that contain a combination of long comments and a great number of comments, breaks the .csv file exported. As can be seen below.

I was able to reproduce this BUG with an issue containing 3 comments, each comment containing 30000 characters, as this seems the easier way to reproduce this BUG, but this result can be achieved by reducing the number o characters in each comment and increasing the number of comments (for example 10 comments with 10000 characters) but the trigger to break the .csv file seems to be a comment with 30000 characters or more (this BUG will be triggered once at least 2 comments with 30000 characters were added, or more comments with a lower character number such as 10000 were added)


h3. Environment
* Any issue(s) that has a great number of comments and long comments (such as an issue with chain email responses as comments)
* Trying to export issues to .CSV, from filter/issue search, with at least one issue with the prerequisite described above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test issue;
# Add at least 3 comments with 30000 characters each;
# Navigate to issue search, and search for this specific issue;
# Click "Export this filter in another format"   !Screen Shot 2018-06-19 at 13.18.12.png|thumbnail!  on the top right corner > Export Excel .CSV File (All fields)
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-19 at 13.17.49.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
* Generated .CSV file is able to export each field to a single column, including all comments, for each issue

h3. Actual Results
* Generated .CSV file overflows the columns for comments, and end up filling the column "Summary" with all the overflown comment content, and all the comments from that point on are added subsequently to the following rows, each comment line being added as a new row. 
* For example, a 1000 issue export .csv file must contain 1001 rows, instead a massive file is generated, sometimes exceeding 65000 lines 

 
h3. Notes
I've included some example .CSV files as examples
* Issue with 3 comments with 30000 characters each
 [^Example issue with 3 comments.csv] 
* Issue with 10 comments with 10000 characters and 1 comment with 30000 characters
 [^Example issue with 11 comments.csv]
fields.summary: Issues with a great number of long comments break .CSV file when exporting to excel

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

(i) Not all customers are affected

The new issue view that relies on getting metadata from the Media store for display and for download link. If an instance done attachment import before, likelihood that it will replace the attachment name with the directory instead, causing discrepancy when viewing issue using this new feature.

This is due to during attachment import, it populates the metadata with the directory order instead of the actual name of the file.
{noformat}
"name": "attachments\/EXAMPLE\/10000\/EXAMPLE-577\/12345",
{noformat}
The expected result should be:
{noformat}
"name": "filename.docx",
{noformat}

This has caused the attachments to be viewed as ID and downloaded as ID instead of it's actual filename on the new issue view.

h2. Steps to replicate

# At one issue, attach a new file, fetch the metadata from Media. Noticed that the name is stored as the filename
# Run attachment import for the same file
# Noticed that media will recreate a new file id and fetching the metadata will have the name stored as the directory order
(!) This is not visible to customers, and only through internal tools we are able to retrieve this information

h2. Workaround

Switch back to old issue view by turning off the new issue view from user profile
fields.summary: File Attachments Names Were Not Stored in Media by Attachment Import
Provide a consistent monospaced markdown that supports trailing or leading spaces and adjacent letters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, we don't have a REST API endpoint to edit Issue Security Levels. We can only GET the Issue Security Level in a given ID.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an endpoint that would allow editing the Issue Security Level so that we can automate the management of the Issue Security Levels, especially when there are a lot of them.

h3. Why this is important
This would make easier the management of the Security Level and we can also automate this management process.
 
h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Creates an endpoint to edit Issue Security Level via REST API

fields.description:
The velocity report typically shows an uneven number of points delivered sprint by sprint, which is expected.  

As Mike Cohn recommends [here|https://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/blog/velocity-driven-sprint-planning]:
{quote}I prefer to take the average of the eight most recent sprints. I’ve found that to be fairly predictive of the future. I certainly wouldn’t take the average over the last 10 years. How fast a team was going during the Bush Administration is irrelevant to that team’s velocity today. But, similarly, if you have the data, I don’t think you should look back only one sprint.
{quote}
 

It would be great to have the velocity report show a trend line with the rolling overage over n=5 or n=8 sprints.  In addition to displaying in the chart, the rolling average could be displayed in the table below.
fields.summary: Trend Line / Rolling Average on Velocity Report

fields.description:
When Performing a bulk edit, the message custom field that is being applied to any of the issues selected by the JQL search, or if the field is active in the project of any of the selected issues it will display all of the message custom fields that are available for those projects at the top of the edit display.

This means that if you have a different message custom field for three different issue types edit screens, and you go to bulk edit issues, you will see three messages at the top of the bulk edit regardless of the issues selected.

It would be better if it was possible to control the placement of the message custom fields, suppress them, or provide more context for them when making bulk edits.
fields.summary: Ability to suppress Message custom fields in bulk edit.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When changing the username of a new user to that of an already deleted user, it does associate the contributions, it instead modifies the username on the *app_user* table on the backend.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 users in JIRA with the same email string but different domains (*yayo.slip@maildrop.cc* and *yayo.slip@mailinator.com*)
# Delete one of the users (*yayo.slip@maildrop.cc*)
# Update the username of the still active account to the username of the deleted account

h3. Expected Results
It associates the contributions of the deleted account to the active account

h3. Actual Results
It does not associate the accounts, it instead modifies the *lower_user_name* of the deleted account in the database on the *app_user* table, adding a #1 as a suffix.

 !Vertigo_Support_Tools___Tenant_Services.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Because the deleted account *lower_user_name* has been modified in the database, this makes undeleting this specific account impossible.
When attempting to re-add the user, it creates a new entry in the database as seen below (*ID10150*)

 !Tenant_Services.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Once the user has updated the username of the active account to its original value, Support will have to manually update the *lower_user_name* to its original value which should be identical to the *user_key* in the database:
{code:sql}
UPDATE app_user SET lower_user_name = '<original username>' WHERE lower_user_name = '<new username>'
{code}

If re-adding the user was attempted, the extra entry will have to be deleted:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM app_user WHERE id = <id number>
{code}

After these changes are completed, the user can re-add the user by inviting them with the original email of the deleted user account.
fields.summary: Deleted username on new user doesn't associate contributions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When an attachment import fails, it fails silently and customer would not be aware until they check the attachments on issues or inspect the element on developer console.

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Navigate to Jira Import Wizard (Systems > Restore system)
# Upload an invalid attachment zip file
# Check the status after migration

h3. Expected Result

Importer will throw error where the file is invalid or not following the structure that is allowed. 

h3. Actual Result

It shows no message or state the import completed successfully. Further inspecting element, enable persist logs, able to get a response where there is an issue with the zip file. 

h3. Impact

This actually becomes an issue if customer has a big attachment backup and it would take a long time to retry, not knowing what could have failed it.
fields.summary: Jira Attachment Import Fails Silently

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user performs a site import for Jira, the existing default mail server used for mail handlers has it's hostname, username, and password wiped

h3. Environment

* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check and confirm default mail handler exists on Cloud instance
# Import a Jira site backup on the same Cloud instance
# Check the mail handler page after import is completed

h3. Expected Results

Default POP Mail Server has the host and username set

h3. Actual Results

Default POP Mail Server has host set to 'localhost' and username set to 'null'

h3.Workaround

You can manually recreate the default POP mail server by editing the mail handler and manually setting hostname to 'mailstore', username to jira@<CLOUD INSTANCE>.atlassian.net, and a random password. Click update to have the changes saved. You should now be able to use the mail server for any of your mail handlers you have set up.
fields.summary: Restoring a Jira backup wipes default incoming POP mail server

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
At the moment, JIRA does not support the ability to bulk update filters. This feature would save our clients time the possibility to bulk edit them.
E.g: when a workflow status is renamed, it would be nice to change the name of this status in the filters using a bulk operation.  

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to bulk edit filters.

h2. Why this is important

To enhance the admin experience, allowing them to have better control over their filters, and also help them to save a lot of time when they update their filters.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to bulk update filters

fields.description:
Within the New JIRA Issue View, the old attachments coming from the JIRA Server Instance  are not displayed with their right names and extensions after migration to Cloud, no preview and the name is a path with an id instead of the <filename.extension>.
The attachment still can be downloaded, and the extension must be added manually to open it.

New JIRA Issue View: 
!Screen Shot 2018-06-14 at 11.44.02.png|thumbnail! 

But they are displayed and downloaded normally within the Issue Navigator.
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-14 at 11.44.32.png|thumbnail! 

Deleting and Re-uploading the file solve the issue but it can be done manually for all the attachments form the migration.
